definitions.definition: an instance or method of presenting a play or other dramatic performance.
examples: one of the better stagings of this Shakesperean classic

definitions.definition: an instance of organizing a public event or protest.
examples: the fourteenth staging of the championships

definitions.definition: a stage or set of stages or temporary platforms arranged as a support for performers or between different levels of scaffolding.
diagnosis or classification of the particular stage reached by a progressive disease.
the arrangement of stages in a rocket or spacecraft.
the separation and jettisoning of a stage from the remainder of a rocket when its propellant is spent.
present a performance of (a play or other show).
examples: the show is being staged at the Goodspeed Opera House

definitions.definition: (of a person or group) organize and participate in (a public event).
examples: UDF supporters staged a demonstration in Sofia

definitions.definition: cause (something dramatic or unexpected) to happen.
examples: the president's attempt to stage a comeback

definitions.definition: diagnose or classify (a disease or patient) as having reached a particular stage in the expected progression of the disease.
